milestone_description: Series F $170M raised from Daimler and others
Delivered 20 Ah sulfide cells to BMW and Ford
Georgia Power 15 MW / 1500 MWh project announced
4680 cell production begins at pilot facility
Campus expansion 100 GWh annual capacity target
Holland MI expansion to 70 GWh announced
Commercial production of Prussian Blue cells begins
QSE-5 single-layer cell performance data released
Commercial deliveries to automotive partners begin
DOE $2B loan for Nevada cathode facility
M3P (LMFP variant) launched for Li Auto
75 MWh Sacramento Municipal Utility District project
Series B $300M led by Bill Gates
A-sample cells delivered to automotive customers
$2B DOE loan finalized for cathode production
Licensing agreements with major cell manufacturers
Sodium-ion cells in Chery EV (first automotive use)
B-sample cells delivered to automotive partners
Series D $200M raised from Mercedes Stellantis Hyundai
$50M Series C extension for automotive scale-up
A-sample Li-Metal cells to automotive partners
Commerce GA expansion 25 GWh additional capacity
5% market share in stationary storage achieved
4680 cell cost parity with 2170 cells achieved
30% of U.S. battery material from recycled sources
First mainstream EV with sodium-ion battery (non-China)
30% of premium EVs using silicon anode
First production vehicles with solid-state batteries
Production vehicles with QS cells on road
50% of U.S. cathode material from recycled sources
15% market share in energy storage globally
Multi-day storage systems at commercial scale
Solid-state approaching cost parity with Li-ion
Silicon anode standard in premium EV segment
U.S. battery production 1 TWh annual capacity
